page.title: 06RECREATION: COILACRIECH
page.content: 1. Fishing. The River Dee is one of Britains most outstanding salmon rivers. From February of each year fishermen are spread all along the banks of the river. Whilst salmon is the prize fish to be caught sea trout are also found in the river. Since the 19th century fishing on the Dee has been a top status symbol, with the fishing rights being almost all privately owned. Perhaps the most famous fisherperson is the Queen Mother, who has a fishing cabin near Ballater. 2. Tourism. The fine scenery of Deeside and Balmoral castle attract many visitors each year. Most of these travel on the North Deeside road from Ballater up to Balmoral and Braemar. They usually just pass through the Coilacr- iech area, at most stopping for lunch.
